intro: Gaultheria tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima wintergreen, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink. Gaultheria tolimensis is also noted for its aromatic leaves, which contain compounds similar to those found in wintergreen oil. This plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests at high elevations.
